name: Lat Stretch
setup: Stand or kneel beside a pole, door frame, or stable anchor
Reach one arm overhead and grasp anchor point
Step or lean away from anchor to create tension
Other hand on hip or hanging relaxed
steps: Reach overhead arm further, elongating lat
Gently lean hips away from anchor point
Feel stretch along side of torso from armpit to hip
Breathe deeply and relax into the stretch
Hold for prescribed time, then switch sides
cues: Feel stretch in lat (side of back)
mistakes: Over-rotating torso instead of lateral flexion
Not creating enough tension (standing too close to anchor)
safety: If shoulder feels uncomfortable, reduce reach or lean. Avoid this stretch if experiencing acute shoulder or rib pain.

regressions: Wall lat stretch (hands on wall, hips push back)
progressions: Hanging lat stretch (dead hang from pull-up bar)
Side-lying lat stretch with foam roller
Active lat stretch with band (pull-down motion)

prescriptionHints.notes: Hold 45-90s per side. Great post-workout stretch for lats and shoulders.

joints.notes: Keep shoulder packed and avoid excessive rotation. Focus on lateral flexion, not twisting.
